Key Match Events: Rhys Hoskins hit a grand slam off Sean Manaea in the first inning
Milwaukee Brewers improved to 11-1 in their last 12 games against the Mets, including a 4-0 record this year
Brice Turang went 3 for 4 with three runs and three of Milwaukee’s six steals — increasing his season total to 50
Gary Sánchez homered late in the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets, Arizona Diamondbacks, and Atlanta Braves are chasing the final two National League wild cards
Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said they kept fighting and didn’t give up
Francisco Lindor went 2 for 4 with a walk and committed an error in his first appearance since Sept. 15
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Mendoza said they got down early, but didn’t give up and need to turn the page
Pat Murphy said Sal Frelick will undergo an MRI on Saturday after leaving the game due to a leaping catch
Alvarez exited with back spasms after sliding into third in the seventh
Miscellaneous Highlights: Manaea gave up six runs — five earned — while lasting just 3 2/3 innings
The Mets trailed 5-0 before Mark Vientos hit a two-run homer off Frankie Montas in the third
New York had runners on first and second with two outs in the fourth when Alvarez worked a 10-pitch at-bat before he struck out looking at a 3-2 pitch that appeared a bit low
Joe Ross (3-6) pitched three innings of shutout relief to earn the win
Trevor Megill got the final out in the eighth and worked a scoreless ninth to earn his 21st save in 24 opportunities
